text: The Corey House, at 106 N. E St. in Bridger, Montana, was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. It was deemed "architecturally significant as a distinctive example of an Arts and Crafts style residence in Bridger". It was built in 1907 for developer L.A. Corey by builder R.R. Crool. With . It stands adjacent to Arts and Crafts-style Glidden House, also National Register-listed. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Montana Category:Bridges completed in 1907 Category:Carbon County, Montana Category:1907 establishments in Montana
title: Corey House (Bridger, Montana)
